Biography: Great Russian writer, thinker, philosopher, and publicist. Author of novels 'Crime and Punishment', 'The Idiot', and 'The Brothers Karamazov'.
American science fiction writer, known for the dystopia 'Fahrenheit 451' and the short story collection 'The Martian Chronicles'.
British writer, author of the Harry Potter novel series. One of the most widely read and commercially successful authors in the world.
Soviet writer, playwright, and theater director. Author of novels 'The Master and Margarita', 'The White Guard', and the play 'Days of the Turbins'.
English theoretical physicist, cosmologist, and author of popular science books, including 'A Brief History of Time'. Studied black holes and the Big Bang theory.
